definition: extra/surplus/remaining/remainder after division/(following numerical value) or more/in excess of (some number)/residue (math.)/after/I/me

sentences.english: But China’s surplus is dropping faster.
sentences.chinese: 但是中国的往来账户盈余漏失很快。

sentences.english: As a result, China’s trade surplus will shrink along with its saving rate.
sentences.chinese: 做为加国，中国的外贸盈余将会同储蓄率一起缩水。

sentences.english: Half a year later, both my husband and I lost all we gained.
sentences.chinese: 半年后，我和丈夫所有的盈余都亏掉了。

sentences.english: Today Britain is not only self-sufficient in oil but also has a surplus for export. The transport and domestic heating systems mostly depend on oil.
sentences.chinese: 今天英国的石油不仅能自给自足，还有盈余供出口。

sentences.english: Chapter 3 The methods of surplus management in new criterion.
sentences.chinese: 第3章新准则下盈余管理的方法。

sentences.english: Last year surplus of HK$17 was set off against subvention received in current year.
sentences.chinese: 去年的17港元盈余已与本年所收的补助金对销。

sentences.english: He urged surplus nations to shift "away from export dependence and toward stronger domestic-demand-led growth.
sentences.chinese: 他敦促盈余国，“将依赖出口转变为扩大内需增长。”

sentences.english: But it had a 9 million dollar surplus in cranberries .
sentences.chinese: 不过在蔓越橘上则有九百万美元的盈余。

sentences.english: Country music has become big business. It brings in 300 million dollars a year.
sentences.chinese: 乡村音乐发展成为一项贸易，每一年盈余三亿美元。

sentences.english: But there is a better way to put these surplus countries' high saving rates to use.
sentences.chinese: 但盈余国的高储蓄率有更好的用武之地。

sentences.english: Having overpaid the bills, I had a balance of credit in my card.
sentences.chinese: 因多付了账单款，我的卡上出现了盈余。

sentences.english: Is China deliberately understating the size of its trade surplus?
sentences.chinese: 中国是否故意少报了其贸易盈余的大小？

sentences.english: To be sure, the absolute size of China's surplus (forecast to be $270bn in 2010 by the IMF) is striking.
sentences.chinese: 当然，中国盈余的绝对数值是惊人的。

sentences.english: Chapter 4 The discernment methods of surplus management in new criterion.
sentences.chinese: 第4章新准则下盈余管理手段的识别方法。

sentences.english: The martingale property and the strong Markov property of this kind of surplus process are discussed.
sentences.chinese: 讨论了该盈余过程的马尔科夫性和鞅性。

sentences.english: Today Britain is not only self-sufficient in oil but also has a surplus for export.
sentences.chinese: 今天英国的石油不仅能自给自足，还有盈余供出口。

definition: variant of 盈餘|盈余[ying2 yu2]
to break even/balance between income and expenditure
expenditures/expenses/CL:筆|笔[bi3], 項|项[xiang4]/to spend money/(coll.) to pay wages
income does not cover expenditure/unable to make ends meet
